citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000-Scale Indian Lands of the United States

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

descript.abstract: This map layer shows Indian lands of the United States. For the most part, only areas of 320 acres or more are included; some smaller areas deemed to be important or significant are also included. Federally-administered lands within a reservation are included for continuity; these may or may not be considered part of the reservation and are simply described with their feature type and the administrating Federal agency. Some established Indian lands which are larger than 320 acres are not included in this map layer because their boundaries were not available from the owning or administering agency.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the national level, and for large regional areas. The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:1,000,000-scale data. No responsibility is assumed by the National Atlas of the United States in the use of these data.
descript.supplinf: Information about National Atlas Web services can be found on the Web Map and Web Feature Services page; see http://nationalmap.gov/small_scale/infodocs/webservices.html.

place.placekt: Organization for International Standards, 2008, ISO 3166 Country Codes, https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#search.

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgment of The National Atlas of the United States of America would be appreciated in products derived from these data.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale

cntinfo.cntinst: For questions about this map layer or metadata, please contact the National Atlas using the information above, or through the U.S. Geological Survey contact page at http://www.usgs.gov/ask/. For distribution questions, please see the Distribution Information elsewhere in this metadata.

dataqual.logic: The map layer was checked for topological consistency using ArcGIS. No other checks for logical consistency were performed on this map layer.
dataqual.complete: This map layer includes Indian reservations in the United States. The minimum map resolution is 320 acres. Generally, features under this size are not shown. Some established Indian lands which are larger than the minimum map resolution are not included in this map layer because their boundaries were not available from the owning or administering agency.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States
citeinfo.title: 1:1,000,000-Scale Federal Lands of the United States

pubinfo.publish: National Atlas of the United States

procstep.procdesc: All lands where the primary, secondary, or tertiary Federal Land type was an Indian Reservation were extracted from FedLands2014. The map layer was saved in shapefile and in file geodatabase formats.

enttyp.enttypd: Areas of 320 acres or more administered by the Bureau of Indian Affairs.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The representation of the entity in the data.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: 2-dimensional element
edom.edomvds: ESRI GIS software

attr.attrdef: The size of the area in square miles. This is a calculated field.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The perimeter of the area in miles. This is a calculated field.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The primary or only type of Federal land. Where an area represents multiple Federal land types, this attribute describes the smaller or 'contained' land. Areas in this data set will have a Federal land type of Indian Reservation in either Feature1, Feature2, or Feature3.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: An area of land reserved for a tribe or tribes under treaty or other agreement with the United States, executive order, or federal statute or administrative action as permanent tribal homelands, and where the federal government holds title to the land in trust on behalf of the tribe.

edom.edomvd: A water area owned or administered by Bureau of Reclamation.

edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: A tract of land, having a wide variety of attributes, protected and preserved for the use and enjoyment of the public.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: An area of essentially undisturbed, roadless, public lands of 5000 acres or more, that retains a primeval character, without permanent improvements and that generally appears to have been affected primarily by the forces of nature.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: A tract of land or water protected for the preservation of wildlife.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

edom.edomvd: A wetland or grassland critical to waterfowl and other wildlife, managed as part of the National Wildlife Refuges Program.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

Areas in this data set will have a Federal land type of Indian Reservation in either Feature1, Feature2, or Feature3.

attr.attrdef: The URL, or Uniform Resource Locator, is the address of a page on the World Wide Web. The address, which provides the basis for establishing an electronic link from a client to the physical location of the page on an Internet server, consists of a server name, file path, and the page's file name. A URL in this map layer is usually the address of a Federal agency website. For example, http://www.nps.gov/findapark/index.htm is the address of a National Park Service page that allows you to locate a park in the National Park system.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

attrdomv.udom: There is no predefined set of valid Uniform Resource Locators.

edom.edomvd: No URL is available for the area.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The 2-character abbreviation for the State or State equivalent in which the Indian land feature is located. If the Federal land feature is in more than one State, the abbreviations are separated by dashes: UT-CO.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: American National Standards Institute (ANSI) Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The 2-digit FIPS code of the State or State equivalent in which the Indian land is located. If the Federal land feature is in more than one State the codes are separated by dashes: 49-08.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

codesetd.codesetn: ANSI Codes for States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas of the United States

attr.attrdef: The name of the feature as supplied by the source agency.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States

attrdomv.udom: There is no predefined set of valid orig_names.

attr.attrdef: The size of the area in acres. This is a calculated field.

attr.attrdef: The size of the area in square decimal degrees. The values for this field are generated by ArcGIS.
